questions.question: Which of the following is not true about ventilation?

options.B: Involves quality control of outgoing air

questions.explanation: Ventilation primarily involves the replacement of vitiated air with fresh air, providing a comfortable thermal environment, and reducing the risk of infection; however, it does not directly involve quality control of outgoing air.

questions.question: What is the ideal number of air changes in a drawing-room?
questions.explanation: -The number of air changes in drawing rooms or living rooms must be 2 – 3 per hour.The number of air changes in work rooms and assemblies must be 4 - 6 per hour.

questions.question: What is ventilation provided by wind blowing through a space called?
questions.explanation: Ventilation provided by wind blowing through a space is called perflation.Ventilation can be broadly classified as natural and mechanical:Natural ventilation includes:Perflation is the ventilation of a space achieved by allowing wind to blow through it andremoving the obstacles for this to happen (e.g., opening windows and doors).•Aspiration occurs when there is an obstruction as wind bypasses it and creates a suction action• Diffusion is the passage of air through small spaces or openings• Cross-ventilation is when air is allowed a natural path through the space by providing openingsat appropriate places, opposite each other.The drawback of natural ventilation is that regulation of air quality is not possible.Mechanical ventilation includes:• Exhaust ventilation utilizes exhaust fans placed high up near the roof on the external walls. Avacuum is created by which fresh air enters the ventilated space.•Plenum ventilation uses centrifugal fans to blow fresh air into the room and create a positivepressure, by which vitiated air is pushed out.586•Balanced ventilation is the combination of both exhaust and plenum methods of ventilation.• Air conditioning can be done through mechanical ventilation. It is the simultaneous control ofall or at least three factors that influence air quality in a confined room or space. These factorsinclude temperature, humidity, air movement, distribution, dust, bacteria, odours and toxic gases.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a social goal of housing standards?
questions.explanation: Prevention of non-infectious diseases is not a social goal of housing standards.The social goals of housing include:• Shelter• Family life•• Access to community facilities• Family participation in community life• Economic stability
